commit.message:
Bump version number for git-publish 1.8.2 release

Changes since 1.8.1:
- Add --send-email-args argument to pass git-send-email(1) arguments
- Show a clear error message when the base branch does not exist

Signed-off-by: Stefan Hajnoczi <stefanha@gmail.com>

Remove "cc" from instect menu filtering

Now that commands can be passed directly to git-send-email there are
more possibilities than just adding a "cc" line. We remove "cc" from the
find line so all the stuff that git-send-email is adding gets shown when
inspect_menu is called.

Signed-off-by: Joel Granados <j.granados@samsung.com>

Add arg that forwards args to git-send-email command

Implement a way to forward args down to the git-send-email call. In this
way you can access all git-send-emails features.

Signed-off-by: Joel Granados <j.granados@samsung.com>

Check the base branch

When the base branch does not exist, git-publish produces a pretty
cryptic error:
ERROR: git format-patch --subject-prefix PATCH --output-directory /tmp/tmps35kpt7n --no-cover-letter master..
fatal: ambiguous argument 'master..': unknown revision or path not in the working tree.
Use '--' to separate paths from revisions, like this:
'git <command> [<revision>...] -- [<file>...]'

Improve the situation a bit with an early check, and some hint.

Signed-off-by: Marc-André Lureau <marcandre.lureau@redhat.com>

Remove unused import

Signed-off-by: Nir Soffer <nsoffer@redhat.com>

Idiomatic use of try-finally

If mkstemp() raise we did not create a temporary file so we don't need
to clean up. If it succeeds, we always have a temporary file. The
idiomatic use is shorter, more clear, and less error prone.

Idiomatic open() usage in inspect_menu()

Ensure that opened files are closed using with statement. A commit since
this code is more fragile.

Signed-off-by: Nir Soffer <nsoffer@redhat.com>

Idiomatic use of fdopen()

fdopen() can be used with a with statement like open() for the same
benefits.

Signed-off-by: Nir Soffer <nsoffer@redhat.com>

Idiomatic use of open()

Using with statement we ensure that the file is closed with less code.

Signed-off-by: Nir Soffer <nsoffer@redhat.com>

Use builtin open instead of io.open

Using io.open is useful to get the same behavior on python 2 and 3, but
since this project is using python 3, we can use builtin open.

Signed-off-by: Nir Soffer <nsoffer@redhat.com>

Remove python2 __future__ imports

Python 3 does not need the `__future__` imports.

Signed-off-by: Nir Soffer <nsoffer@redhat.com>

Don't crash when email message lacks Subject header

Normally email messages have subject headers, but if the user edits the
email in their editor and makes it empty (probably because they changed
their mind and don't want to send an email yet) then git-publish
crashes:

  Traceback (most recent call last):
    File "git-publish/git-publish", line 953, in <module>
      sys.exit(main())
    File "git-publish/git-publish", line 910, in main
      selected_patches = inspect_menu(tmpdir, to, cc, patches, suppress_cc,
    File "git-publish/git-publish", line 507, in inspect_menu
      print(m['Subject'].strip())
  AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'strip'

Skip printing the Subject header when it doesn't exist.

Signed-off-by: Stefan Hajnoczi <stefanha@gmail.com>

Add options --no-thread and --thread

These map directly into git-send-email's --[no-]thread.

Signed-off-by: Alberto Faria <afaria@redhat.com>

Add option --skip

Add a --skip=N option that automatically unselects the first N patch
emails, including the cover letter if any.

This is equivalent to choosing [s] and removing the first N lines.

If N is negative, select only the last -N patch emails.

Signed-off-by: Alberto Faria <afaria@redhat.com>

Bump version number for git-publish 1.8.1 release

Changes since 1.8.0:
- Fix shell metacharacter regression with cccmd

Signed-off-by: Stefan Hajnoczi <stefanha@gmail.com>

Fixes cccmd no longer seems to be invoked

Fixes #111

The problem is that QEMU's `.gitpublish` contains `2>/dev/null` that doesn't work well with `subprocess.Popen()`

Signed-off-by: Yonggang Luo <luoyonggang@gmail.com>

Bump version number for git-publish 1.8.0 release

Changes since 1.7.0 include:
- Fixed character encoding when invoking git, editors, etc.
- Replace NamedTemporaryFile usage since it does not work on Windows
- Use the git's mbox format variant so that line endings are correct in
  emails
- Use git format-patch --cover-from-description=none so cover letters
  are always populated correctly by git-publish
- Print an error when invoked outside a git repo

Signed-off-by: Stefan Hajnoczi <stefanha@gmail.com>

Drop years from Red Hat copyright

Red Hat's latest copyright guidance says to simply use "Copyright Red
Hat". Switch to that in ./git-publish to eliminate the need to update
the year, which is easily forgotten.

Signed-off-by: Stefan Hajnoczi <stefanha@gmail.com>

Native encoding are not capable edit all characters, for author names can not represent int native encoding

Signed-off-by: Yonggang Luo <luoyonggang@gmail.com>

subprocess.call would result invalid encoding output in powershell,
so capture the output first and then print it out

Remove blank email item in edit_email_list

Signed-off-by: Yonggang Luo <luoyonggang@gmail.com>
Refactoring edit_content out

workflows: use ppa:git-core for git-email

The ubuntu2004 image contains git packages from ppa:git-core. The system
git-email package fails to install due to dependency conflicts with
ppa:git-core. However, ppa:git-core is not enabled in the image, so it
must be re-enabled before installing git-email.

Signed-off-by: Stefan Hajnoczi <stefanha@gmail.com>

git-publish: use the git mbox format

There are many variations of the mbox format. Git uses '\n' line
endings, does not wrap lines, and has a From_ line.

The SMTP and HTTP policies that are currently used in the code do not
match git's mbox format precisely. Often this goes unnoticed because
there is some tolerance in git-send-email(1), but Peter Xu found that
'\r\n' line endings result in lines with trailing '\r' characters when
the quoted-printable transfer encoding is used by git-send-email(1).

Define git's mbox format policy and use it throughout the code. While
we're at it, make sure the From_ line is written when the cover letter
file is edited.

Originally-by: Peter Xu <peterx@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Stefan Hajnoczi <stefanha@gmail.com>

Don't pick up the branch description in the cover letter

"git format-patch --cover-letter" populates the body with the branch
description instead of the placeholder text by default. This prevents
"git publish" to replace it with the actual body that is kept in the
<branch>-staging tag.

Just tell "git format-patch" to only populate with the placeholder text.

Signed-off-by: Greg Kurz <groug@kaod.org>

git-publish: print an error when invoked outside a git repo

The GitError backtrace from git_get_toplevel_dir() is hard for users to
interpret. Print a simple error message reminding the user that
git-publish must be run from within a git repo.

Note that git_get_toplevel_dir() caches the result so this code change
does not slow down startup. git will be executed the same number of
times as before.

Fixes: #103
Suggested-by: Yixun Lan <dlan@gentoo.org>
Signed-off-by: Stefan Hajnoczi <stefanha@gmail.com>

Bump version number for git-publish 1.7.0 release

Signed-off-by: Stefan Hajnoczi <stefanha@gmail.com>
Fix a flag in some error message

Decode patch selection NameTemporaryFile

After selecting "[s] Select patches to send (default: all)" and exiting
GIT_EDITOR after saving git publish, the following error is produced:

  Traceback (most recent call last):
    File "git-publish", line 914, in <module>
      sys.exit(main())
    File "git-publish", line 871, in main
      selected_patches = inspect_menu(tmpdir, to, cc, patches, suppress_cc,
    File "git-publish", line 468, in inspect_menu
      output = git_send_email(to_list, cc_list, patches, suppress_cc,
    File "git-publish", line 247, in git_send_email
      return _git_with_stderr(*args[1:])[0]
    File "git-publish", line 86, in _git_with_stderr
      print('git ' + ' '.join(args))
  TypeError: sequence item 9: expected str instance, bytes found

Decode the file when reading since NameTemporaryFiles are opened in
'w+b' mode by default.

Fixes: #101
Signed-off-by: Stefan Hajnoczi <stefanha@gmail.com>

workflows: use python 3.8

With default python (3.6) we had this issue:
https://github.com/python/cpython/pull/13391

Signed-off-by: Stefano Garzarella <sgarzare@redhat.com>

Test case for empty subject line in the cover letter

Add a test case to check "No subject line" error (issue #96)

Signed-off-by: Stefano Garzarella <sgarzare@redhat.com>
